text: - Do you have the proof?
GREGG PHILLIPS: Yes.
- Will you provide it?
- Can I have it?
- Why?

GREGG PHILLIPS: We're
not-- we're-- we're--

the rest of the tweets-- there
was a whole series of tweets.

Those were taken
slightly out of context.

But-- but one of the key
tweets that we have--

have stuck with all along
is, we're going to release
all of this to the public.

We're going to release
our methodology.

We're going to
release the raw data.

We're going to release
our conclusions.

We're going to release
everything to the public.
- When?

GREGG PHILLIPS: As soon as
we get done with the checks.

- But why would I
believe your conclusion

if you won't show me your
method and means and analysis?

GREGG PHILLIPS: Whether
you believe it or not
doesn't mean that it's not true.

Whether you have the information
or not doesn't mean that

I don't have the information.
- Right.

But if you can't--
GREGG PHILLIPS: Truth is truth.
- But if you can't produce--

GREGG PHILLIPS:
Irrespective, right?
- Ronald Reagan.
Trust but verify.

You're not allowing the
second part of that equation,

because you haven't put
out the information.

And you're doing it
to the disadvantage

of a lot of Americans who want
to know the answer to this.

GREGG PHILLIPS: There's
3 million people's

own veracity on whether or not
they're citizens in the balance
here.

We're not going
to make a mistake.
- But that's on you.

GREGG PHILLIPS:
We're gonna do this.

We're doing it.
- But you already accused them.

GREGG PHILLIPS: Look.
I'm not a politician.
I'm just a guy.
- I know.

GREGG PHILLIPS: We're
following [inaudible], man.
- But that's an excuse.
That's a convenience.

You put it out there, got picked
up by all these righty sites.

It made its way
to the president.

He's now putting
it forth as truth.

You've got to show
what you know.
GREGG PHILLIPS: We will.
- But when?

GREGG PHILLIPS: When
the time is right.
- What does that mean?
When the time is right.
The time is right right now.
That's why we're here.

I didn't just bump into
you in the hallway.

You came here to
talk about this.

GREGG PHILLIPS:
Look at it this way.

The technology exists for the
federal government right now--

today-- to match this data
out and give us the answer.
Right?
- I don't know.

GREGG PHILLIPS: The Department
of Homeland Security
has the information.

They can match it
against the voter file.

And they can give
us this answer.
- I don't know that.

GREGG PHILLIPS:
So why won't they?

- I don't know that anything
you're saying is true.

I don't know that they know who
every non-citizen is who voted
illegally in the United States.

GREGG PHILLIPS: They will as
soon as they make the match,

and as soon as Attorney
General Sessions orders that

be done and--
- Well, hold on.

So are you saying you're
waiting for somebody else

to do something so
they'll know the answer?

Because I'm not waiting on
the government to tell me

GREGG PHILLIPS: I'm saying
it's easier for them.
For us, it's tedious.
- But what I'm saying is-- look.
Either you know or you don't.

What I'm hearing from
you is, you think
you'll be able to show it.
GREGG PHILLIPS: No.

What you're hearing
is that-- that I know.

You just don't
believe that I know.

- But why would I believe it
if you don't show how you know.

Come on, this is a very
silly circle that we're
going in here right now.
GREGG PHILLIPS: Sure.
- You say you can prove it.
I say, OK.
I trust you.
You can prove it.
Show me.
You say, I will.
But you're not.

Can you give me
an estimated date?

GREGG PHILLIPS:
We believe that it

will probably take another
few months to get this done.

- And yet, even though
you need a few more

months to get it done, you think
you know the answer right now.

GREGG PHILLIPS:
We're volunteers.
We know we have the answer.

- Even though you can't
prove it, you think you know.

GREGG PHILLIPS: The
number's actually bigger.
- Well, whatever.

You can say the number
is whatever it is.
You have to show it.
